intro: Bupleurum gussonei, commonly known as the Sicilian angelica, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Bupleurum gussonei is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits. Its ornamental value also makes it a sought-after plant in horticultural gardens.
